document.docAuthor: Giroti, André Marsola & Brescovit, Antonio Domingos
document.masterDocTitle: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Segestria mollis Holmberg, 1876 : 25
, fig. 6 (♀? holotype from Buenos Aires, Argentina, unknown depository, lost).

Segestria vulgarissima Holmberg, 1876 : 9
, 25, fig. 7 (♀ holotype from Buenos Aires, Argentina, unknown depository, lost).— Mello-Leitão (1933: 12, Syn.) .

Ariadna mollis—
Mello-Leitão (1933 : 12, Transf. from
Segestria
; 1944: 312, 322, fig. 1, Descr. ♂ ; 1947: 233, 234).— Bonnet (1955: 735) .— Beatty (1970: 475, figs 1, 16‒17, 22) .—De la Serna de Esteban (1976: 139) .— Prandi (1990: 3, figs 1, 3‒5, 10‒11) .— Grismado (2008: 354, figs 1, 8L‒M, 10A‒D) .— Grismado & Izquierdo (2014 : 154, figs 3, 11a ‒b).—Pérez- González et al. (2016: 36, fig. 2G).— World Spider Catalog (2018) .

Ariadna spinifera Mello-Leitão, 1947 : 233
, fig. 1 (♂ holotype from Curitiba [25°25'47"S; 49°16'19"W], Paraná, Brazil, V.1942 , R. Lange leg., deposited in MHNCI 2486, examined).—
Beatty (1970: 483, as nomem dubium )
.—
NEW SYNONYMY
.

Ariadna crassipalpus—
Camargo (1950: 445, fig. 3h, Descr. ♀ , misidentification)
.

Synonymy.
Ariadna spinifera
was described by Mello-Leitão (1947) based on an adult male which presented a similar coloration and macrosetae pattern with
Ariadna mollis
, except by the presence of a abdomen with a darkened dorsum, as opposed to the evident dark dorsal pattern commonly found in
A. mollis
. After the examination of the holotype of
A. spinifera
, we confirm the similarity with a male
A. mollis
, so we considered
A. spinifera
a junior-synonym of
A. mollis
. Camargo (1950) described a female from São Paulo as an alotype of
A. crassipalpa
. After the detailed examination of this specimen's internal genitalia, it was observed that it is a female of
A. mollis
, evidencing a misindentification of the author.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 20.
Ariadna mollis (Holmberg, 1876)
. Male from Parque Estadual do Jaraguá (IBSP 166961) (A‒E): habitus, dorsal (A) and ventral view (B); right leg I, prolateral (C) and retrolateral view (D); right metatarsus I, ventral view (E). Female from Instituto Butantan (IBSP 72885) (F‒I): habitus, dorsal (F) and ventral view (G); right leg I, prolateral (H) and retrolateral view (I). Scale bar: 1mm.

FIGURE 21.
Ariadna mollis (Holmberg, 1876)
. Male from Parque Estadual do Jaraguá (IBSP 166961) (A‒B): left palp, prolateral (A) and retrolateral view (B). Female from Perdizes (MZSP 1709) (C‒D): Internal genitalia, lateral view (C); Anterior receptaculum, ventral view (D). Scale bar: 1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Ariadna mollis
is similar to
A. crassipalpa
,
A. boesenbergi
,
A. calilegua
,
A. changellkuk , A. levii
and
A. perkinsi
due to the dark abdominal pattern with arrow-shaped marks ( Figs 1A‒C , 18A, F , 20A, F , 22A, F , 31A, E , 45A, F , 47A, F , 50A, F ), but differ, except
A. crassipalpa
, by the presence of males with a sinuous metatarsus I bearing a ventro-prolateral macrosetae in its median region, short and curved ( Fig. 20C‒E ); it differs from
A. crassipalpa
by having a tubular embolus tip, not twisted, and palpal tibia less incrassated, with the dorsoventral diameter smaller than the bulb ( Fig. 21A‒B ); females differ from these species, except
A. crassipalpa
and
A. calilegua
, by having the anterior receptaculum with lobes of similar size, differing from the last ones by the presence of a regular and smooth cuticle ( Fig. 21C‒D ).

Variation. Male (n=10): Total length: 6.04‒9.12; carapace 2.92‒4.36 long, 1.92‒3.0 wide; femur I 3.0‒4.88. Female (n=10): Total length: 9.84‒13.92; carapace 4.32‒5.48 long, 2.8‒3.48 wide; femur I 3.0‒4.12.
Distribution. South and southeast of Brazil ; east of Argentina ; Uruguay ( Fig. 72 ).
